stories.text:
What investments have you made in yourself as a developer that have really paid off?

I've found high level books written by experienced developers have really helped me. In the past I'd try to learn this or that shiny new thing but found little long term gain.

What's been your long term successes?
stories.title: Ask HN: What has improved You as a Developer?

Creating a Custom Generative Adversarial Network with Sketches

stories.text:
This considers simple UP/DOWN monitoring by external observer. This is not about agents running on servers.

I am looking for:

* ability to monitor arbitrary online services/protocols including custom ones

* in practice, the call itself should be pluggable to cover niche and custom use cases

* open source and self-hosted

* nice to have built-in support for common use cases like HTTP, HTTPS, SSH monitoring

I guess I'm looking for a user interface and scheduling framework of otherwise mostly custom-made calls.
stories.title: Ask HN: Tool or framework to monitor arbitrary services and protocols?
